name: Rachel
description: Customer Support Lead with 6 years in sports betting customer service. Manages a 15-person support team handling 500+ tickets daily. Responsible for customer satisfaction, ticket resolution times, escalation management, and translating customer feedback into actionable insights for product and operations teams.

empathy_map.think_and_feel: My team is the face of the company when things go wrong. I need answers fast when customers are upset. I feel helpless when I can't explain why a market wasn't available. I want to turn frustrated customers into satisfied ones. I worry about escalations damaging retention and reputation.
empathy_map.hear: Customers: 'Why can't I bet on this match? Competitor has it' | Team: 'I don't know if this is our fault or provider's' | Traders: 'Tell support Provider X is down' | Management: 'Why is satisfaction dropping?' | Legal: 'We need documentation for this dispute'
empathy_map.see: Spike in tickets after provider outages. Customers comparing our markets to competitors on social media. Team spending 30+ minutes investigating single tickets. Repeat tickets from same customers. Negative reviews about 'limited markets' or 'slow payouts'.
empathy_map.say_and_do: Triage tickets and escalate to trading/tech. Check provider status manually when customers report issues. Explain settlements and voids (often without full context). Document known issues in Slack. Follow up after issues resolved. Report trends to management.
empathy_map.pain: No visibility into provider status during live events. Can't see if market was unavailable or missing. Settlement delays aren't communicated until customers complain. Have to interrupt traders for provider info. Lack of historical data to prove 'provider issue, not us'. Hard to set expectations without knowing provider timelines.
empathy_map.gain: Dashboard showing real-time provider status and known issues. Ability to look up events and see which providers covered them. Automated notifications for settlement delays. Historical logs to prove provider issues for disputes. Proactive customer communications. Reduced ticket volume through transparency.

defining_experiences.impact: Betradar went down during UCL final. 300+ tickets in 2 hours. Customers furious. Team overwhelmed. I had no info from trading. Customers blamed us, not provider.
defining_experiences.lesson: Support is the front line but last to know. Need real-time provider status. Can't help customers without information. Proactive communication > reactive apologizing.
defining_experiences.how_it_shapes_me: I'm obsessed with visibility. I push for support-facing dashboards. I want to know about issues BEFORE customers do.

defining_experiences.event: Built Provider Status Dashboard for Support (2024)
defining_experiences.impact: Worked with ops team to build simple dashboard showing provider up/down status. Ticket resolution time dropped 30%. Team morale improved. Customers appreciated transparency.
defining_experiences.lesson: Simple visibility tools have huge impact. Support needs data, not just apologies. Transparency builds trust.
defining_experiences.how_it_shapes_me: I advocate for support tools. I show ROI (faster resolution, better CSAT). I collaborate with ops/product.

defining_experiences.impact: LSports settlement delayed 4 hours. 500+ tickets. Customers threatened chargebacks. I had no timeline from trading. Chaos.
defining_experiences.lesson: Settlement delays are high-stakes—customers' money is involved. Need automated notifications and ETAs. Can't just say 'we're working on it.'
defining_experiences.how_it_shapes_me: I prioritize settlement issues. I push for automated notifications. I train team on de-escalation.
